Sales Tests Package

The sales.tests package provides testing functionality for the sales package, including performance profiling, memory profiling, and unit tests.

Submodules

The sales.tests package includes the following submodules:

sales.tests.profile_sales module

The sales.tests.profile_sales module focuses on performance profiling for the sales package, enabling detailed performance analysis of key functions and operations.

sales.tests.profile_sales.profile_all_tests()[source]

Profiles all test functions in the test suite using cProfile.

sales.tests.profiler_memory module

The sales.tests.profiler_memory module monitors memory usage for the sales package, helping to optimize memory consumption during operations.

sales.tests.profiler_memory.run_memory_profiling()[source]

Runs pytest while profiling memory usage for the tests.

sales.tests.test_app module

The sales.tests.test_app module contains unit tests for the sales package, ensuring the correctness and reliability of its features.

sales.tests.test_app.add_default_admin(db_session)[source]

Adds a default admin user to the database.

sales.tests.test_app.add_inventory_item(db_session)[source]

Adds an inventory item to the database.

sales.tests.test_app.add_product_manager(db_session)[source]

Adds a product manager user to the database.

sales.tests.test_app.add_regular_user(db_session)[source]

Adds a regular customer user to the database.

sales.tests.test_app.app()[source]

Creates a Flask application configured for testing.

sales.tests.test_app.client(app)[source]

Provides a test client for the Flask application.

sales.tests.test_app.db_session()[source]

Creates a new database session for a test.

sales.tests.test_app.get_auth_tokens(client)[source]

Logs in all users to obtain JWT tokens. Returns a dictionary with ‘admin’, ‘user’, and manager tokens.

sales.tests.test_app.test_add_wishlist(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test adding an item to the customer’s wishlist.

sales.tests.test_app.test_add_wishlist_already_there(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test adding an item to the wishlist that’s already there.

sales.tests.test_app.test_add_wishlist_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test adding a non-existent item to the wishlist.

sales.tests.test_app.test_get_item_by_id(client, db_session, add_inventory_item, get_auth_tokens, add_regular_user, add_product_manager, add_default_admin)[source]

Test retrieving an inventory item by its ID.

sales.tests.test_app.test_get_item_by_id_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test retrieving a non-existent inventory item by its ID.

sales.tests.test_app.test_get_items(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test retrieving all inventory items.

sales.tests.test_app.test_get_items_by_category(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test retrieving inventory items by category.

sales.tests.test_app.test_purchase_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test purchasing an item with sufficient wallet balance and stock.

sales.tests.test_app.test_purchase_item_insufficient_amount(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test purchasing an item when the wallet balance is insufficient.

sales.tests.test_app.test_purchase_item_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test purchasing a non-existent item.

sales.tests.test_app.test_purchase_item_no_stock(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test purchasing an item when there is insufficient stock.

sales.tests.test_app.test_remove_wishlist(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test removing an item from the customer’s wishlist.

sales.tests.test_app.test_remove_wishlist_no_item(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test removing a non-existent item from the wishlist.

sales.tests.test_app.test_remove_wishlist_not_there(client, db_session, get_auth_tokens)[source]

Test removing an item that is not in the wishlist.

Module Contents

The sales.tests package integrates all testing modules for the sales package, enabling comprehensive validation of sales-related functionality.
